content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey, Monica, and Phoebe are there as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Check it out! This is unbelievable! Joey has been holding his breath for almost four minutes!
(We see Joey who has puffed up his cheeks and Chandler nonchalantly reaches down and pinches Joey’s nose shut. In a few seconds, Joey has to move because he’s now forced to actually hold his breath.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! What are yo—you trying to kill me?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, I wanna ask you something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well since I’m movin’ out and-and you’re so beautiful…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …how about I move in with you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, that would be great but then what do we do about Denise?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who’s Denise?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My roommate.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You have a roommate?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, Denise. Denise!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what is with the secrecy Phoebe? Huh? And what about this Denise, is she cute?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs, I don’t understand. How can you have a roommate that none of us know anything about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe because you never listen to anything that I say. I talk about her all the time! DENISE!!!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach, listen I was thinkin’ uh, I’m gonna have an extra room over at my place…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that’s true.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, why don’t you move in with me? It’ll be great! We could stay up late, watch movies, and you know about Naked Thursday’s right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, yeah I think I’m gonna find my own place.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey! I thought Naked Thursday’s was just our thing man!

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is reading a magazine, eating a cookie, and drinking some coffee as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, what did Rachel say when you told her you were still married to her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, that. Umm, she took it really well.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You didn’t tell her did you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Of course not, because you’re in love with her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am not in love with her. She was very upset about having to move out so I eh, didn’t tell her we were still married because she would only get more upset. I-I just comforted her, as a friend.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What do you mean, comforted her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s nothing, I just gave her a hug.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah-ha! A classic sign of love, the hug!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s also a sign of friendship.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, not in your case Lovey Loverson. (Tries to take a bite out of Ross’s cookie.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was a hug!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, just tell me this, did you or did you not smell her hair?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: S-s-smell her hair? What if I did?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ninety percent of a women’s pheromones come out the top of her head! That’s why, that’s why women are shorter. So that men will fall in love when they hug them! (Ross is staring at her dumbfounded.) Oh come on Ross, you’re a scientist.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was hugging her as a friend. It’s not my fault her-her hair got in my face, she’s got a lot of it and it smells all-all uh…coconutty. (Phoebe raises her eyebrows.) What?! Oh, that doesn’t mean I have feelings for Rachel! Maybe it means I have feelings for coconuts!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, whatever you say. But just be careful, all right? Rachel’s not in the same place you are.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: If the place you are referring too is being in love, then she is in the same place as me because I am not in that place!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I didn’t understand that, but y’know, maybe that’s ‘cause you were speaking the secret language of love!

(She goes for his magazine and he grabs it away before she reaches it. But she was only using the magazine as a decoy because she grabs his cookie and coffee, takes a bite out of the cookie and drinks some of the coffee.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Monica are there as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (To Chandler) Dude, some guy just called for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who was it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! How about, “Thanks for taking the message.” Jeez! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay listen, y’know when you move in Rachel’s room is gonna be empty, you wanna talk about what we want to do with it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I was thinking we should have a beautiful guest room, right? With a mahogany sleigh bed and bedside tables with flowers on them all the time! And we could have a roll top desk with comment cards on them so people could say how much they loved staying here!! Okay, whatever, I really haven’t thought about it that much.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I like that idea. Obviously! I was thinking maybe-maybe-maybe it could be a game room, y’know? I mean you can buy old arcade games like uh, like Space Invaders and Asteroids for $200, the real ones! The big-big ones!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay so you mean no as in, “Gee Chandler, what an interesting idea. Let’s discuss it before we reject it completely.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Of course I mean that. Interesting idea, umm, talk about it, but no.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, that’s it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just don’t think arcade games go in the beautiful guest room. The beautiful guest room is gonna be filled with antiques.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Which is why Asteroids is perfect! It’s the oldest game!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you have against the beautiful guest room?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t have anything against the beautiful guest room, especially since everybody we know lives about 30 seconds away!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you mocking me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I’m not mocking you, (in a mocking voice) or you beautiful guest room. (Exits.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is coming from across the hall.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what’s up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing, Monica and I had a stupid fight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you’re still moving in together, right? Because my ad came out today. (Shows him the paper.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: “Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly.” Nice!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah? I just figured y’know, after living with you it’d be an interesting change of pace to have a female roommate, y’know? Someone I can learn from, someone-someone who’s different than me. And what’s more different than me; a guy who’s not 19 than say a girl who is 19? Enh? (Points to his head.) Not just a hat rack my friend!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is on the couch staring off into space as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, I have to ask you…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shhhhhh! I’m swamped right now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re just staring into space.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I’m trying to move that pencil. (There’s a pencil lying on the table.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This one? (Picks it up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It worked!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, this whole apartment thing is just a nightmare! Every place I can afford comes with a roommate who is a freak. I mean, look at this; (Points to one and starts to read it.) “Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly.” It’s just, there is nothing! The city’s full!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, no, look at this! (Points to one.) (Reading) “Two bedroom, two bath, must be non-smoker, Satan worshipers okay…” Oh, yeah, but it’s on the ground floor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, uh, you still looking for a place?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, there’s this guy, Warren, from the museum and he’s going on a dig for like two years and he’s got this great place he needs to sublet. So uh, you interested?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That sounds great! I’d love to live at Warren’s!! I love Warren! Thank you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t thank me! If you wanna thank something, thank the volcano that erupted thousands of years ago, killing but perfectly preserving an entire civilization. (Rachel just looks at him.) Here’s Warren’s number.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, this is great! I am gonna call him right now! (Jumps up.) Oh, thank you!
(She hugs him and he starts to hug her back but notices the look Phoebe is giving him and pushes her away.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, you go grab it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I saw it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I’m talking about that which you already know but won’t admit. You love her again; you re-love her!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I do not re-love her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe you won’t just admit it! (Pause) Okay, just promise me that you won’t do anything stupid.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, we’re just friends now! Okay? Why would I do anything stupid?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh!!! Well, the apartment is already subletted! I mean, this is just hopeless. I’m never gonna find anything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You can live with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Are you serious?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. (Phoebe grunts.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I would love to live with you Ross; that’s-that’s great! Thank you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m-I’m just glad I could, y’know, help you out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! I’m-I’m so happy for you guys. (To Ross) This is so-so, not stupid.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross-Ross, you have no idea what this means to me! I mean, I mean I was gonna be homeless. You just saved me! You’re my hero!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hero, I uh, I don’t know—well, all right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I have to go tell Monica what a wonderful brother she has! (Kisses him on the cheek and exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh please! (He sits down.) (To Phoebe) You’re gonna say things now, aren’t ya?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. No, I won’t. But I should tell you this, this exact same thing happened to my roommate Denise. She moved in with a guy who was secretly married to her and he said he didn’t love her, but he really did, and it just blew up! And that’s how she ended up living with me! (Ross looks at her.) (Pause) Okay, that’s a lie.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is in the kitchen as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, listen, I’m sorry about before. I don’t need to have a game room. I mean when I was a kid I only played those games because I couldn’t get girls, and now I can ‘em—Now, I have you. (Monica glares at him.) Not-not that I think that I have you or think of you as property in any sort of way, I see women…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stop it Chandler. (Chandler is relieved) I’m sorry too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! Oh yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Listen, we don’t have to make that a guest room, we can think of something to do with the room together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a great idea! We can easily think of a way for us both to enjoy the room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Totally!
(They start thinking.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We don’t have to come up with this now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, y’know what? Why don’t we think about changes we can make in the living room?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Changes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I mean we’re gonna have to move around some furniture to make room for my chair. (Kisses her and heads into the living room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re-you’re-you’re gonna bring the Barca Lounger over here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that a problem?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it’s a set and they should probably stay together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s cool. Then I’ll just bring them both over.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See now-now you’re taking them away from their home.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I get it. So, I get nothing! Nothing here is mine! Everything here is yours! I’ll get up in the morning put on your clothes, and head off to work!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah-yeah, y’know what? Yeah, that’s it-that’s it, everything will be mine! Nothing will be yours! That’s-that’s what I said! Oh come on, Chandler! I’m talking about the barca lounger! It just, it doesn’t match! Where is it gonna go?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: In the game room!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look it is not my fault that your chairs are incredibly ugly!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! That’s fine! That’s fine! I won’t bring over the chairs! I won’t bring anything over! I wouldn’t want to ruin the ambiance over here at Grandma’s place!! (Storms out.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is interviewing a potential roommate. And yes, she’s a female, non-smoker and very non-ugly.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Everything on your application looks really good—Ohh! Just one last question umm, are you and your friends gonna be over here all the time like partying and hanging out?
content.parenthetical: exiting from Chandler’s room with the new roommate

content.speaker: The Potential Roommate
content.text: Oh don’t worry, I’m not really a party girl.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa!! Now look, don’t be just blurtin’ stuff out. I want you to really think about your answers. Okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can call off the roommate search! (To the potential roommate) Hi! I’ll be living here. (Heads for the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh don’t listen to him, he’s just some guy who really wants the apartment, but I don’t think he’s gonna get it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why did you take the shower curtain down?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That thing was a hazard! (To the potential roommate) I’m very safety conscious.

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, Rachel is entering and Ross is making some room on the shelves for his stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Oh listen, I was just clearing some space for your stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh thanks, but listen, I was just at Monica’s and she and Chandler had a big fight and they’re not moving in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you mean, they’re not moving in? They-they’re still moving in right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, they just had a big blowout over what to do with my room.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! Over a stupid room!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I feel kinda bad for them, but I’m also really psyched ‘cause I don’t have to move in here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no, yeah no, that part’s great!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is entering, dragging Chandler, to mediate the argument between Chandler and Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s all this about you guys fighting?! Is this really over a room?! I mean, that is so silly!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, we can handle this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, apparently not, and I can’t just stand by and watch two people I care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. I mean, enough of the silliness!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, why don’t you tell her to stop being silly! (Monica mocks him and he joins in.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay-okay! Two very good points, look I’ve known you both a long time, and I’ve never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as you’ve been since you’ve got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we are fond of the silliness, but we also have a soft spot for the love.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Love is the best medicine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s laughter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why do you do it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! All right! Now, Chandler you-you wanna live with Monica, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And Mon, you wanna live with Chandler, don’t ya?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good! A verbal contract is binding in the state of New York! (Storms out.)

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is sitting at the counter waiting for Gunther, yep Gunther’s back, to refill her coffee.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: So I understand you’re looking for a place.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, I’m staying put.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh, I was going to offer you my apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why, where are you going?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re never gonna believe it uh, Monica and Chandler are moving in again. That’s great news right—I mean for them. Right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah but, on the bright side, we get to be roommates again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Y’know umm, uh, umm, about that, umm, Ross I really appreciate your offer to let me move in and everything, but don’t you think it’s gonna be weird?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wh-why?! Why-why-why would it, why would it be weird?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, because of us! Because of our history.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! It would be weird if we were still in that place, I mean are you still in that place?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Not at all!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good! Me neither! So it’s not a problem. We’re just two friends who happen to be roommates.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, but Ross, eventually you and I are gonna be dating.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?! We are?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! I’m gonna have a boyfriend, you’re gonna have a girlfriend…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh! That would be great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But y’know what, if you think it’s gonna be okay we’ll just work out a system. Y’know, it’ll be like college, I’ll hang a hanger on the door and put a sign, “Come back later, I’m gettin’ lucky.” (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I didn’t think of that.
content.parenthetical: laughs as well, but for a different reason

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is once again being dragged in by Ross so he that he can try to manipulate the situation so that it’s best for Ross, not necessarily what’s best for Monica and Chandler.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So are you sure about this whole moving in thing?! I mean it’s a really big step! And-and what’s the rush?!
(They both start laughing at him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s very funny!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s being silly, because he knows that we enjoy the silliness!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I-I-I’m serious, okay? I mean, think about it. You move in, you start fighting over stupid game rooms, next thing y’know you break up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, you were right before, it was just a stupid fight about a room.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, there are no stupid fights!! This isn’t about the room, this is about what the room…represents! And unfortunately, this room (Points to Rachel’s room) could destroy you!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m not so worried.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, no, me neither.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine! It’s your life! (Starts to storm out mad about his failed attempt at the manipulation of his best friend and sister, but stops and tries one last time.) I just don’t want to see you guys break up! Which you will do if you move in together, (Monica and Chandler just stare at him.) but that’s what you want, there’s nothing I can do. (Opens the door and tries one more time.) DON’T DO IT !!!!! (Finally leaves.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You still want to move in together right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Of course!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross didn’t scare you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Scared me out of ever wanting to live with him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come here, I want to show you something!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!
(They run to the living room where Monica has moved the chair back (Towards the step), the coffee table forward (Towards the TV), and taped a square outline on the floor.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! Someone’s killed Square Man!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is where I thought the barca lounger could go! You see you could see the TV and it’s still walking distance to the kitchen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s so sweet! I want to show you something too!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know those big-big uh, road signs that say “Merge?”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know? So I was thinking that we could get one of those signs and hang it over our bed. Because, that’s you and I together! Merge!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! I love that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, no!!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing a new song. Yep, the first new Phoebe song of season six, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are also there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I found you in my bed! How’d you whined up there? You are a mystery! Little black curly hair! Little black curly hair! Little black, little black, little black, little black, little black curly hair…………
(Applause.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now if you want to receive e-mails about my upcoming shows, then please give me money so I can buy a computer.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So umm, where are the other guys?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, well let’s see Monica and Chandler are occupied.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fighting?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, the other thing. I really think it’s great they work things out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. There’s no breaking them up, is there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, can I borrow the key to your house so I can run across the street and make a copy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure! Here. (Hands her his keys.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (Gets up) Now are you sure? Because once I make a copy, there’s no turning back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I’m-I’m sure. (Deadpan) Yeah, get out of here before I change my mind. (She exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, listen, Ross do you really think this moving in with Rachel is a good idea?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve been back and forth.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah well, maybe you should go back! Okay? Rachel moves in, and before you know it you’re right where you don’t want to be! Back together!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ehh, I don’t, I don’t think so. She’s already talked about y’know, dating other guys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not gonna work out! Then she’s gonna come home all weepy and you’ll be tellin’ her, “Oh that’s okay. You’ll find someone.” And then, bamn ! She finds you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well, m-maybe you’re right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I am telling you Ross, she is definitely gonna fall in love with you again! Now, is that what you want?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that what I want?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes.
(Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here she comes. Hold on, I’m gonna make your life much easier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, well the place was closed. I’ll just copy it later.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or not. Uh, Rach, why don’t you just move in with me? (Rachel sighs.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa, Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no… It’s okay, I mean I—look Rach, I know I scared you off with that whole Naked Thursday’s thing, but we don’t have to do that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it would be easier to move just right across the hall. Wait a minute, unless you’re thinking about Naked Wednesday’s.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thursday’s clearly not good for ya, pick a day!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey has The Potential Roommate back for another interview.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!
content.parenthetical: opening the door to The Potential Roommate

content.speaker: The Potential Roommate
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come in. Thanks for comin’ back, umm, okay there have been a lot of people interested in the room, but I have narrowed it down and you are one of the finalists!

content.speaker: The Potential Roommate
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay now, before I make my final decision I uh, I just want to make sure our personalities match. Okay, so I made up a little test. Now, I’m gonna say a word and then you say the first thing that comes to mind.

content.speaker: The Potential Roommate
content.text: I can do that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! Here we go. Pillow.

content.speaker: The Potential Roommate
content.text: Fight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Very good! Okay. G.

content.speaker: The Potential Roommate
content.text: String?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excellent! Okay umm, doggy.

content.speaker: The Potential Roommate
content.text: Kitten?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, sorry! No-no-no, so close though, but—bye-bye! (He ushers her out the door.)
